slides.card_title: The World Has Shifted from Democracy to Occult Technocracy
slides.insight_text: What we used to call 'democracy' is no longer fully true. While it looks like citizens vote and have choices, real control has moved to hidden systems. These systems manage what we see, how we think, and how we act without most people even realizing it.

Power moved quietly from governments and parliaments to invisible systems. Algorithms now track our behavior, predict our actions, and control outcomes. Most people are unaware because it happens invisibly, like a current under the surface.

Today, control doesn’t need armies or chains. It works through digital systems that know your habits, likes, and fears. Phones, social media, and even your bank can predict your decisions. This is the essence of technocracy: rule through systems, not people.

This kind of hidden control is not new. History shows that rulers, magicians, and secret societies always tried to replace Allah’s authority with their own. Anything that demands obedience instead of Allah is called Ta'ghut.

Busy schedules, endless entertainment, and constant distraction prevent us from thinking critically. Islam calls this state ghaflah (heedlessness). Being constantly occupied stops us from questioning unjust systems.

Education often trains obedience instead of critical thinking. Students are taught to memorize, comply, and chase success without questioning authority. Courage and truth are not rewarded; conformity is.

Routine, survival, and daily pressures teach many Muslims to think Islam is just rituals. Real Deen includes justice, governance, and resisting oppression. Focusing only on personal routine limits spiritual and social responsibility.

When people are constantly worried about rent, jobs, and status, they have no mental space to question injustice. The Ummah becomes tired and sedated. Comfort replaces courage, and obedience to systems seems safer than obedience to Allah.

slides.card_title: The Only System That Threatens Them
slides.insight_text: Islam as a complete system threatens exploitative power because it challenges tyranny, greed, and blind obedience. That’s why technocratic systems try to weaken it. The Prophet ﷺ said Islam began as something strange and will return to being strange.

The elite use fear of losing income or comfort to control people. True trust in Allah for sustenance (tawakkul) removes this fear. When you rely on Allah, no human system can enslave or manipulate you.

The current system is preparing for Dajjal. People who submit to Allah will see the deception and act rightly. Those who submit to the system instead of Allah will fall into the trap. Awareness and reliance on Allah are revolutionary acts.

slides.card_title: Light Isn't the Fastest Thing in This Universe
slides.insight_text: Even whispers, tears, and prayers reach Allah instantly. They don’t need to move through space.
Light is limited by laws of the universe, but Allah and His commands are not.

slides.card_title: A Whisper That Crosses Seven Heavens
slides.insight_text: When you pray silently, Allah hears directly. It doesn’t travel step by step like sound.

slides.card_title: Duʿā Does Not Travel... It Transcends
slides.insight_text: Duʿā exists in Allah’s command (Amr) and is not bound by space or time.
Angels move faster than light because Allah commands them, not because of physics.
Blessings on the Prophet ﷺ reach him instantly, no matter how many people send them.
During Miʿrāj, the Prophet ﷺ traveled faster than light. Space and time folded around him.

slides.card_title: Why This Should Terrify and Humble You
slides.insight_text: Allah knows everything instantly. Every thought, prayer, and intention is heard immediately.

slides.card_title: The Sky is Full of Gates, Portals and Doors
slides.insight_text: The sky is not empty. It has gates that control what can go up or down.
Even if it looks empty, the heavens have paths and rules. Things don't just float freely.
Allah calls them gates. They are real structures for control and direction, not symbols.
During the Prophet’s night journey, angels had to ask for entry at each sky. Gates only open with permission.
Even though heavens are far, Mi'raj happened quickly. When Allah opens a path, distance collapses.
Du'as travel through special routes at certain times. Sincere prayers and repentance reach Allah through these gates.

slides.card_title: Decrees Descend Through the Same System
slides.insight_text: Allah's commands, mercy, and punishment also follow specific paths. Nothing comes randomly.

slides.card_title: Why We Cannot See the Gates
slides.insight_text: Humans cannot see the gates. Our perception is limited, and hiding some things protects our minds.
Above you are real gates and pathways. Your prayers, deeds, and actions interact with them. Choose wisely.

slides.card_title: The Ascension That Most Never Realize
slides.insight_text: Good deeds and prayers travel upwards to Allah. Sins act like heavy weight, stopping or slowing them.

slides.card_title: When Deeds Try to Rise... But Can't
slides.insight_text: Not all acts of worship reach Allah if your life is full of sin. Sins make your deeds heavy and stuck.

slides.card_title: The Sky That Opens... Or Slams Shut
slides.insight_text: Heaven has gates. Sins can close them. Only those pure and obedient can pass freely.

slides.card_title: Angels Report... But What Do They Report?
slides.insight_text: Angels record deeds. Sins make your report dark, and darkness cannot rise to higher realms.

slides.card_title: Sin as a Psychological & Cosmic Weapon
slides.insight_text: Repeated sin changes your mind. You stop feeling awe, fear, and connection to Allah.

slides.card_title: When Du'ā Stalls in the Lower Realms
slides.insight_text: Prayers from haram acts may not reach Allah. The sky may remain silent, showing blockage.

slides.card_title: The Night When Gates Open... Or Don't
slides.insight_text: Allah opens special gates at night for du'a. But only sincere, pure hearts see them respond.
The worst punishment is not hellfire first—it is your prayers being blocked. Tawbah instantly clears the path.

slides.card_title: You Are Building Your Sirāt Right Now
slides.insight_text: Everything you do today—good or bad—affects the bridge you will walk in the afterlife. Choices matter now, not later.

slides.card_title: The Bridge That Is Not Just a Bridge
slides.insight_text: The Sirāt is a real bridge all souls must cross. It’s not a story, it’s your future meeting the truth of your deeds.

slides.card_title: Every Soul Carries Its Own Light
slides.insight_text: Your deeds create a light that helps you move on the Sirāt. The stronger your good deeds, the brighter your light.
Not everyone crosses the same way. Your own life choices shape your bridge, speed, and stability.

slides.card_title: A Multi-Realm Structure, Not a Single Line
slides.insight_text: Even if billions cross at the same time, each soul has its own path in a higher-dimensional reality designed by Allah.
Sins weigh your soul and can make crossing harder. Good deeds lighten it. This is like moral physics.

slides.card_title: Sirāt & Physics: The Architecture Beyond Reality
slides.insight_text: The bridge reacts to your inner state, not your size. Justice is built into the structure itself.

slides.card_title: Prophet ﷺ Stands at the End of Sirāt
slides.insight_text: The Prophet ﷺ prays for mercy at the end. He does not judge; he reminds us that hope remains even after justice is done.

slides.card_title: Why Sirāt Comes After Judgment, Not Before
slides.insight_text: Sirāt shows what your deeds really became. There’s no excuse, no hope left—just your true state.
Light (faith and guidance) cannot be borrowed. If you relied on others, you’ll face collapse when your own light is gone.

slides.card_title: You Are Building Your Sirāt Right Now
slides.insight_text: Your prayers, obedience, and sincere efforts today strengthen your bridge for the afterlife. Every small action matters.
Samiri tricked people without armies. Just by waiting and knowing how people think. Bad choices can spread fast.

slides.card_title: Samiri: The Shadow Between Revelation and Deception
slides.insight_text: Even when a prophet is speaking to Allah, someone else can use tricks to mislead. Being close to knowledge doesn’t make you good.

slides.card_title: How Did Samiri See What Others Could Not?
slides.insight_text: Samiri could see hidden things, but seeing is not believing. True guidance comes from submission to Allah.

slides.card_title: The Footprint: Rūh, Frequency & Misused Knowledge
slides.insight_text: Samiri used leftover sacred energy wrongly. Knowledge without respect for Allah can become dangerous.

slides.card_title: Why Did the Calf Low? Psychology + Deception
slides.insight_text: People think something is real when it looks or sounds real. Samiri used this to make people believe in a fake god.

slides.card_title: Satan's Role: Why Samiri Was an Ideal Vessel
slides.insight_text: Shaytān uses smart people who are arrogant or careless. Knowing things is not enough without humility.
Samiri was isolated instead of killed. Bad patterns can live on even if the person is gone. Learn from history.

slides.card_title: Samiri & End Times: The Recurrent Archetype
slides.insight_text: Samiri’s methods are repeated throughout history. Tricks, symbols, and shortcuts can mislead people if faith is weak.
Today’s false leaders use technology instead of calves. The method is the same: make people trust systems over Allah.
Even with new tools, the pattern repeats: false certainty, fear, and distraction. Only Allah’s guidance is true.
Just because you see something or understand it doesn’t mean it is right. True guidance comes from submission to Allah.
Allah created different beings for different tests. Jinn were given long lives. Humans were not.
Time does not feel the same for everyone. What feels long to humans may feel short to others.
Humans are made from heavy matter that gets old. Jinn are made from something lighter, so they age differently.
Jinn live in a world we cannot see. Because their world is different, time works differently for them.
Humans were given short lives to remind them that this world is temporary and that they will return to Allah.

slides.card_title: Long Life Is Not Always Good
slides.insight_text: Living longer does not always mean being better. It can mean more mistakes and more regret.
People forget the Hereafter because this world keeps them busy and comfortable.
Even those who live very long will be judged. A short life is still enough to choose right or wrong.
